result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Robert James Drummond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC
Continuation of no contact with 6 Billings Drive, Superior, WI.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

Pay as required by Clerk of Courts. Restitution payments of no less than $182 per month commencing December 1, 2022 and due on the first of every month. 75 days jail imposed and stayed for purposes of payment of restitution: 10 jail jail for the first missed payment, 15 days jail for the second missed payment, 20 days jail for the third missed payment, and 30 days jail for the fourth missed payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Robert James Drummond

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
AND ARRAIGNMENT 8:35 AM Defendant Michael Robert James Drummond appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Michael Robert James Drummond.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelsen asks that defendant be brought over in person. Case to be adjourned for defendant to appear in person. 
9:11 AM Defendant Michael Robert James Drummond in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Michael Robert James Drummond.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that Count 1 be dismissed but read in. Defendant to plead to Count 2 - Withheld sentence for 3 years probation. Conditions of probation include comply with programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, continuation of no contact order, pay mandatory court costs and pay restitution of $6,550. Restitution payments of $182 a month commencing December 1, 2022. 75 days jail imposed and stayed for purpose of payment of restitution with first missed payment 10 days jail, second missed payment 15 days jail, third missed payment 20 days jail and fourth missed payment 30 days jail. State has complied with victim's rights. Attorney Nelsen received information and pleads no contest to Count 2. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 2. Attorney Nelsen stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes for Count 2 - Withheld sentence for 3 years probation. Conditions of probation include comply with programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, continuation of no contact with 6 Billings Drive, pay mandatory court costs, 43 days jail with credit of 43 days served. and pay restitution of $6,550.  Restitution payments of no less than $182 a month commencing December 1, 2022. 75 days jail imposed and stayed for purpose of payment of restitution with first missed payment 10 days jail, second missed payment 15 days jail, third missed payment 20 days jail and fourth missed payment 30 days jail.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
9:44 AM . Defendant Michael Robert James Drummond in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Michael Robert James Drummond.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. 
Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact with 6 Billings Drive, Superior, WI

1:31 PM Defendant Michael Robert James Drummond appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Reid appears in court with Defendant. Attorney Peter Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Address verified. Attorney acknowledges receipt, waives reading, requests preliminary hearing.
State requests $1500 cash, with no contact with #6 Billings Drive Superior. Cites priors. 
Attorney Reid indicates Superior address, lifelong resident, works at Super One. Asks for lower cash bond.  Can post $200
Court orders 1000 cash, with conditions of no contact with 6 Billings Drive, Superior, WI
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.
